intro: Michelia sonlaensis, commonly known as the Son La michelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and ovate, with a smooth margin and a glossy surface. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its natural distribution in forested areas.
